Description: Deep bowl (beaker) of Nile silt pottery, coated on the exterior with red slip with black top and burnished; flat base, splayed sides and wide mouth. Incised post-firing with a potmark on the side. The interior is untreated.
Curator's comments: Marked B201 on side. Potmark illustrated in W.M.F Petrie and A.C. Mace, Diospolis Parva, London (1901), pl. xxiii.250. Like Black top red ware B19b in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921).
Condition: good (cracked and rim chipped). Rim worn from use; exterior surface worn lower half.
